content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    result = words[1]
    line_length = length(words[1])
    for i in 2:length(words)
        if line_length + 1 + length(words[i]) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * words[i]
            line_length = length(words[i])
        else
            result *= " " * words[i]
            line_length += 1 + length(words[i])
        end
    end
    return result
end

# Example
input_str = "This is a test string for wrapping"
wrap_string(input_str, 10)
```
